title: [GOBBLIN-25] Gobblin data-management run script and example configuration
body: This pull request adds a run script for the ```DatasetCleanerJob``` class which is used in the ```gobblin-data-management``` module to run retention process. There is also example configuration to complement the retention module docs.

1. Added `MetadataAwareFileSystem` which instruments permission change related `FileSystem` operations.
2. Created `DatasetAwareMetadataProvider` to provide metadata at dataset level. Reused the existing `GlobalMetadata`.
3. Tested with the `SimpleConfigMetadataProvider` using Gobblin-kafka jobs.

title: Rename directory after compaction is complete
body:
This change is to bridge the gap between old renaming logic for databus-etl, and the new compaction logic in MRCompactionTask. 

In old renaming logic, after the compaction is compete, the directory will be renamed to {DIRNAME}_COMPLETE. Replicate the same logic in the MRCompactionTask now. 

The change will only take effect when compaction.rename.source.dir.enabled=true

title: Throttling and Config Library improvements
body:
This PR makes various changes to improve how throttling server uses config library.

* Add a policies endpoint to throttling server to query the policy for a particular resource.
* Add expiring resources to broker so policies can be reloaded (to always get the newest one from config library).
* Refactor config library client to make loading of few configs more efficient.
* Refactor Hadoop fs config store to make it less confusing.

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Stream based record processing.
body:
This is an overhaul of record processing in ETL tasks in Gobblin. The major changes are:

* Make record metadata a first-class citizen of Gobblin. Instead of passing raw records around the pipeline, it now uses `RecordEnvelope`s containing the record, metadata, and relevant callbacks. `RecordEnvelope`s are transparent to all constructs that don't care about them.
* Callbacks are first-class citizens. Each record has a collection of callbacks that get called whenever the record is written, dropped, or failed. Any construct can add callbacks to the record.
* The processing of records is based on java `Stream`s instead of a synchronous record-by-record processing. This will allow, in the future, to do async/out-of-order record processing.

title: Implement FlattenNestedKeyConverter
body:
Given configuration:
```
FlattenNestedKeyConverter.fieldsToFlatten="address.city,address.zipcode"
```

A `FlattenNestedKeyConverter` will add top level fields "addressCity" and "addressZipcode" into the outputSchema. Their values will be the same as what the nested keys refer to in the inputRecord.

title: Partitioned avro
body:
-  Refactor DatePartitionedAvroFileSource to separate out the mechanism of
    retrieving files that match a watermark from the logic of creating work
    units.

-  Add a regex based partitioner. This is similar to
    DatePartitionedNestedRetriever, but is optimized for cases where there
    are a small number of snapshots in the source directory and the
    snapshots themselves may be materialized at semi-random intervals.

title: [GOBBLIN-211] Implement new salesforce writer
body:
### Overview
An async salesforce writer built on top of the async http writer framework. Old suite of `HttpWriter` and `SalesforceRestWriter` are marked as deprecated.
### Auth
`OAuthAccessToken` provides a standard way to authenticate using OAuth. `SalesforceAuth` is a `OAuthAccessToken` with specific way to extract information from config.
### Client
`ApacheClient` provides a standard way to send apache `HttpUriRequest` and get `CloseableHttpResponse`. `SalesforceClient` is a `ApacheClient` integrated with authentication.
### Writer
`SalesforceWriterBuilder` instantiates `SalesforceClient`, `SalesforceRequestBuilder`, `SalesforceResponseHandler` and plugs them into an instance of `AsyncHttpWriter`. It builds an `AsyncWriterManager` that wraps the `AsyncHttpWriter` instance.

title: Throttling HA
body:
This PR is 95% around throttling server HA, with some other changes that were used in previous attempts at HA but are useful either way.

The general idea of HA is as follows:
* Multiple Throttling servers coordinate through Zookeeper to elect a leader.
* Any request to a non-leader returns a 301 redirect to the leader.
* Clients use as input a list of URIs in the cluster (in the future will use D2 uri instead) and chose an initial URI at random.
* Clients transparently process 301 redirects and repeat the request to the new leader up to a maximum number of redirects. The redirect is sticky, i.e. the client remembers the active leader, and all future requests will go to that leader (until a new redirect is received).
* If the client cannnot connect to the stored host, it resets by round-robin'ing over the list of input URIs.

Major changes:
===========
Server side
----------
* Introduction of `LeaderFinder`, an interface allowing a cluster of processes to elect a leader, and allowing each process to get metadata on the leader.
* Introduction of `ZookeeperLeaderElection`, a `LeaderFinder` based on Zookeeper leader election.
* The `ThrottlingGuiceServletConfig`, which is the `ServletContextListener` used to configure the throttling server, was changed to automatically instantiate a `LeaderFinder` if a zk string is provided. Also, it becomes stateful even when not launching through a servlet (for example, when launching through `EmbeddedRestliServer`.

Client side
----------
* Introduction/refining of `RequestSender`, which abstracts the sending of a `PermitRequest` to the throttling server. This also allows easily injecting Mock servers for testing.
* `RestClientRequestSender` uses a `RestClient` to send a permit request.
* `RedirectAwareRestClientRequestSender` is a `RequestSender` than transparently handles redirects, sticky routing, and failures to communicate with the current stored uri.
* `ExponentialBackoff` is a class used to implement generic exponential backoff. Put it in gobblin-utility because it is not the first time I wish we had one of these.

title: Fix for #1792
body: Fixed #1792 by moving the handling of the case where `ConfigurationKeys.JOB_CONFIG_FILE_DIR_KEY` exists, but `ConfigurationKeys.JOB_CONFIG_FILE_GENERAL_PATH_KEY` does not to the constructor.  In this case, the `ConfigurationKeys.JOB_CONFIG_FILE_GENERAL_PATH_KEY` is added to the property set with the value `"file://" + this.properties.getProperty(ConfigurationKeys.JOB_CONFIG_FILE_DIR_KEY)`.  Then during startup, if properties contains `ConfigurationKeys.JOB_CONFIG_FILE_DIR_KEY`, the job file monitor is started.

2) Removed "{@link #SERDE_SERIALIZER_FILE_EXTENSION}" from javadocs as they were not declared anywhere.
3) Added "com.esotericsoftware.kryo:kryo:2.22" dependency for supporting TEXTFILE format.
4) Added a test, to convert Avro to TEXTFILE. This test is also a validation that TEXTFILE format is supported and can be used for serializing and deserializing.

Note: In order to support TEXTFILE, following properties should be passed from job/pull file.
serde.deserializer(or serializer).type=TEXTFILE

title: Refator HTTP writers
body:
- Introduce a new framework to construct http writers
- Abstract the way to send request(`HttpClient`), the way to build a request(`RequestBuilder`), and the way to handle a response(`ResponseHandler`) of a http writer
- Provide a new Salesforce http writer solution based on the existing solution(`SalesforceRestWriter`).
- Implement `RecordSyncHttpWriter` which processes record synchronously
- Implement `BatchAndSendSyncHttpWriter` which batches records and then sends the batch synchronously.

@ibuenros @yukuai518 Please review.

title: Stress testing classes for throttling service.
body:
There are two main sets of changes in this PR:

Stres Test for Throttling
=================

* There are two stress tests: `MRStressTest` and `LocalStressTest`.
* A `Stressor` is a class that sends requests to a `Limiter`. Different stressors can simulate different usage patterns.
* The `LocalStressTest` uses and embedded throttling server and multiple threads to run a stressor. The requests do not go through the network, but the stress test can add artificial latency representing the network latency. Every 15 seconds, the stress test logs statistics about the throttling.
* The `MRStressTest` uses a real throttling server. It spawns multiple mappers each one running a stressor. The mappers emit their effective permit use rate every 15 seconds, which then gets collected by the reducer to compute the global effective QPS every 15 seconds.

Throttling algorithm updates
=====================

* Some changes to the batching algorithm. The previous algorithm was keeping the permit requests open for a long time (~7 seconds under high contention) because it allowed up to 7 seconds to acquire even a small number of permits. The new algorithm uses a short timeout instead, generally just short enough to satisfy the minimum number of permits requested. Larger permit allocations only happen if there are permits stored (meaning low contention).

title: Ability to configure Graphite reporters with metric names prefix
body:
Hello again :)

In our company we are using some optimized Graphite installation as the metric store. Metrics are categorized by their names according to some DDD rules (names consist of domain and context: `{domain}.{context}.{application}.{metric-name}`). Because of that convention, we need to have an ability to define some application-wide prefix for metric reporters. This is, I think, the standard way of configuring Graphite reporters in many open source applications.

If you want to use prefix in Graphite reporters, you need to define `metrics.reporting.graphite.prefix` property i `application.conf`:

```
metrics.reporting.graphite.prefix="tech.hadoop.gobblin"
```

Current behavior is preserved when the property is omitted. 

Let me know if it is OK :)

title: Initial version of compaction using customized gobblin task
body:
The first version of compaction flow which use customized MRTask.

Some component introduced:
1) CompactionFileSystemGlobFinder represents a dataset finder relying on a glob pattern search, an example of returned dataset is {basedir}/DB/Table/{hourly|minutely}/2017/04/07/21 directory.
2) CompactionVerifier is a verifier that will be used when user need to perform sort of validations before creating a workunit, or starting a real map-reduce job.
3) CompactionParser is used when user wants to parse a dataset to a list of meaningful components like basedir, subdir, time, datasetName, etc.
4) CompactionCompleteAction is some post actions required after a  compaction MR job is completed.
5) CompactionSource is a gobblin source which currently works with LocalJobLauncher to create multiple workunit. Each workunit will serialize dataset and pass it to MRCompactionTask.
6) MRCompactionTask is a customized MRTask which deserialize a dataset from workunit and launch a new map-reduce job for this specific workunit(or dataset).
7) CompactionSuite is a collection of 1) - 4) components. Different applications should customize this suite and use their own components as necessary.

title: Fix distcp from CLI hang
body:
@ibuenros 

`bin/gobblin run distcp foo bar` was hanging on exit whenever any file was actually copied. The root cause was that `FSAwareInputDataStreamWriter` overrode `close()` without calling the superclass method -- this caused the metric updater thread from `InstrumentedDataWriterBase` to hang around forever because it was never shutdown.

This fix is correct, but I'm not sure if we should also be started the metric writer thread as a daemon thread vs one that can hang the process -- thoughts?

- Remove shadowed closer variable since the superclass defines one already
- Remove overridden close() method - it wasn't calling super.close()
which was causing bugs, and is now irrelevant since the parent close
will close resources properly

body:
During creation of WorkUnits in HiveSource, failure to create a single WorkUnit shouldn't lead to failure of Job.
Some exceptions in this case (eg. UpdateNotFoundException) are often wrapped as UncheckedExecutionException leading to failure of Job.

title: Fixing bug in gobblin.configuration.State
body:
A State can have properties other than commonProperties and specProperties. 

For example WorkUnitState extends State. Hence WorkUnitState does contain commonProperties and specProperties. A WorkUnitState also contains WorkUnit(extends State). Hence a WorkUnitState contains properties other commonProperties and specProperties in the form of Properties belonging to a WorkUnit.

I encountered this error when workUnitState is passed as a parameter to the State constructor leading to loss of few properties.
